title.value: Активность алкогольдегидрогеназы и глюкозо-6-фосфатдегидрогеназы в листьях и корнях проростков ячменя (Hordeum vulgare) в условиях совместного действия низкой температуры и избыточного увлажнения
Alcohol dehydrogenase and glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity in leaves and roots of barley (Hordeum vulgare) seedlings under combined action of low temperature and excessive humidity

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Dremuk, I.A., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering
Shalygo, N.V., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering

abstract.value: During the vital process agricultural plants are often turned out in unfavorable environmental conditions, such as low temperature and excessive humidity of soil. Excessive humidity of the soil leads to hypoxia of the plants, declining the cell level of adenosine triphosphate and increasing synthesis of stress (anaerobic) proteins due to inhibition of aerobic breath. The article presents the research of combined influence of both low temperature and excessive humidity of the soil on activity glycolysis enzymes. It is shown that under combined action of low temperature and excessive humidity there are changes in respiratory exchange by means of intensification of glycolysis and pentose phosphate pathway of glucose oxidation through activation of key enzymes – alcohol dehydrogenase and glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase respectively. Thus increase of alcohol dehydrogenase activity in roots and leaves of barley is associated mainly with excessive humidity effect. Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase activity in roots is due to low temperature action and in leaves is caused by excessive humidity effect.
